comment:
Variables:
- \( x \): number of automatic electric car jacks to purchase
- \( y \): number of gas-powered car jacks to purchase

Parameters:
- \( P_{electric} = 5 \): cars processed per hour by automatic electric car jack
- \( P_{gas} = 4 \): cars processed per hour by gas-powered car jack
- \( E_{electric} = 6 \): units of electricity used by automatic electric car jack per hour
- \( G_{gas} = 7 \): units of gas used by gas-powered car jack per hour
- \( E_{max} = 50 \): maximum units of electricity available
- \( G_{max} = 80 \): maximum units of gas available
- \( E_{limit} = 15 \): maximum number of automatic electric car jacks allowed

Objective:
Maximize the total number of cars processed per hour:
\[ \text{Maximize} \quad 5x + 4y \]

Constraints:
- Number of automatic electric car jacks must be less than or equal to the limit:
\[ x \leq 15 \]
- Total units of electricity used must not exceed the maximum available:
\[ 6x \leq 50 \]
- Total units of gas used must not exceed the maximum available:
\[ 7y \leq 80 \]
